titleStmt.title: Sir Phillip Stapleton dead of the sicknesse at Callice: and the names of others of the 11 impeached members that went over with him. And their truncks, chests, and boxes of moneys, and jewels, found in the ship by Captain Batten. Also severall proposalls which they had to make to the Queen of England and to the state of France: whither they are not now admitted to come and of their going to Flushen, and the reasons thereof, certified by a letter from Dover.
titleStmt.author: Lawcey, William.

notesStmt.note: Dated and signed at end: Dover this 23. of August. 1647. Will. Lawcey.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
